Class Icons

java.lang.Object
cat.dam.roig.cleanstream.ui.util.Icons
public final class Icons extends Object
Utility class for loading, scaling and composing icons used in the UI.

Responsibilities:

  • Load icons from classpath resources
  • Scale them to a fixed square size
  • Cache scaled icons to avoid reloading and rescaling
  • Overlay one icon on top of another (e.g. cloud badge)

This class is intentionally final with a private constructor because it only exposes static utility methods.

Caching strategy

Icons are cached using a ConcurrentHashMap with a composite key: 
     path + "@" + size
This ensures that:
  • The same icon path with the same size is only loaded and scaled once
  • Different sizes of the same resource are cached independently

Thread-safe by design thanks to ConcurrentHashMap.

Author:
metku

  • Method Details

    • icon

      public static Icon icon(String path, int size)
      Loads an icon from the classpath and scales it to the specified size.

      If the icon has already been requested before with the same path and size, it will be returned from cache.

      Parameters:
      path - resource path (e.g. "/icons/video.png")
      size - desired width and height in pixels (square)
      Returns:
      scaled Icon, or a default file icon if resource not found

    • overlay

      public static Icon overlay(Icon base, Icon over, int x, int y)
      Creates a new icon by drawing one icon on top of another.

      Typical usage:

      • Base icon: video/audio/file
      • Overlay icon: cloud badge

      Parameters:
      base - base icon (drawn at 0,0)
      over - overlay icon
      x - x position of overlay relative to base
      y - y position of overlay relative to base
      Returns:
      composed icon as a new ImageIcon
